posts.post_content:
In a format where a lot of non-basic lands are played, if you cast this during your opponent's upkeep, won't you shut him down for the turn?  
  
Could be useful in the sideboard vs an opponent you know doesn't have much/any artifacts and play a lot of non-basic land.

Posted By: Deathtamoor (4/18/2010 1:49:31 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
A far too specific ability to be useful without being a cantrip or at least a slowtrip.  
It might be chosen by Ben Bleiweiss as #1 crap card, and he said it'd still be pretty useless as cantrip, but I've got still some cards in mind i consider slightly worse than this one.  
  
Given that you actually play against a deck with a no or very few artifacts that only uses nonbasics (which is already quite rare, but still not as unlikely as several other bad cards which act in a very specific way in non-block-constructed play), you can at least for one turn [Silence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Silence) him/her and prevent paying certain activated or triggered abilities. And yeah, talking about Silence and such, this one is a hundred times better for instance. And you are even affected by this drawback as well, but consider that you might already tapped out or kept your basic lands untapped for further spells.  
  
But of course this one is certainly still not playable an incredibly bad pick afterall.  
Gotta spash blue... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: TheWrathofShane (12/27/2012 12:51:19 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This card... is the worst card I've ever seen. It was released at a time when most nonbasic lands rarely gave mana OTHER than colorless and it's of limited use even today since it doesn't deny mana, just colored mana. Even with the modern proliferation of dual color lands it sucks because it has no lasting influence and shuts down YOUR dual color lands as well, thus preventing you from casting good counterspells. It was also released in the same block (and rarity slot) as Parallax Tide which works MUCH better as a land hoser. If it was an Enchantment or cantrip then it would be still be bad, but it would at least do SOMETHING. As it stands, the card may as well read "Wave goodbye to two mana".
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
1 out of 5? Say what? Considering how many dual lands players have these days, this card has a good chance to hose many decks. Just cast it during their upkeep. Yes they can tap their dual lands for mana, however that mana disappears at the end of the upkeep step.   
  
Against the right deck, this card reads: Until end of turn, target player can't cast colored spells or activate abilities with colored mana costs. Nowadays, this card would probably cost ![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol) and/or cantrip, but still, far better than its current 1.169 rating.
posts.html:
1 out of 5? Say what? Considering how many dual lands players have these days, this card has a good chance to hose many decks. Just cast it during their upkeep. Yes they can tap their dual lands for mana, however that mana disappears at the end of the upkeep step.

Against the right deck, this card reads: Until end of turn, target player can't cast colored spells or activate abilities with colored mana costs. Nowadays, this card would probably cost and/or cantrip, but still, far better than its current 1.169 rating.
